result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D. Herget was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 281 days granted.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs, DNA and Image Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling and sex offender treatment recommended by Agent.
No contact with victims, J.M., D.S. and C.R.
Not to possess anyone else's identification except for his own.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
No possession or use of a computer or any technological device with Internet capabilities without prior permission from the Agent.
No possession of any pornographic and/or sexually explicit material.
Compliance with the Sex Offender Registration Program.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior Agent approval.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert D. Herget in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 281 days)
  -  3  YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  - 5 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling and sex offender treatment recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  any victims (J.M. and D.S. and C.R.)
*Not to possess anyone else's identification except for his own
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*No possession or use of a computer or any technological device with internet capabilities without prior permission from the agent. 
*NO possession of any pornographic and /or sexually explicit material
*Compliance with the Sex Offender Registration Program
No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 without prior agent approval

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

IMAGE SURCHARGE:  $500.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
